name: df-padd
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(cpadd, cmpt(s0, universe, cmpo(s1, s2, cpw(cfv(catm, cv(s0))), cpw(cfv(catm, cv(s0))), cun(cun(cv(s1), cv(s2)), crab(s3, cfv(catm, cv(s0)), wrex(s4, cv(s1), wrex(s5, cv(s2), wbr(cv(s3), cfv(cple, cv(s0)), co(cv(s4), cfv(cjn, cv(s0)), cv(s5))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ +P =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s1 ‚àà P((Atoms ` s0)), s2 ‚àà P((Atoms ` s0))‚Ü¶((s1 ‚ãÉ s2)‚ãÉ { s3 ‚àà(Atoms ` s0)| ‚àÉ(s4 ‚àà s1, ‚àÉ(s5 ‚àà s2, s3[(le ` s0)](s4[(join ` s0)]s5)))})))
comment: Define projective sum of two subspaces (or more generally two sets of atoms), which is the union of all lines generated by pairs of atoms from each subspace. Lemma 16.2 of [MaedaMaeda] p. 68. For convenience, our definition is generalized to apply to empty sets. (Contributed by NM, 29-Dec-2011.)
